# Stop backend and frontend services (2025-11-03 07:48Z)

_**User (2025-11-13 12:44Z)**_

Can you kill the backend and frontend running on 3000 and 3001? 

---

_**Agent (model gpt-5, mode Agent)**_



---

I'll terminate any processes listening on ports 3000 and 3001 and report the result.

---

<tool-use data-tool-type="shell" data-tool-name="run_terminal_cmd">
<details><summary>Tool use: **run_terminal_cmd** â€¢ Run command: for p in 3000 3001; do pids=$(lsof -ti tcp:$p -sTCP:LISTEN 2>/dev/null || true); if [ -n "$pids" ]; then echo "Killing $pids on port $p"; kill -9 $pids 2>/dev/null || true; else echo "No listeners on port $p"; fi; done</summary>

```bash
for p in 3000 3001; do pids=$(lsof -ti tcp:$p -sTCP:LISTEN 2>/dev/null || true); if [ -n "$pids" ]; then echo "Killing $pids on port $p"; kill -9 $pids 2>/dev/null || true; else echo "No listeners on port $p"; fi; done
```

```
Killing 25239 on port 3000
Killing 25252 on port 3001
```
